name: B. Polo the Penguin and Houses
statement:
Little penguin Polo loves his home village. The village has houses,
indexed by integers from 1 to . Each house has a plaque containing an
integer, the -th house has a plaque containing integer ().Little penguin
Polo loves walking around this village. The walk looks like that. First
he stands by a house number . Then he goes to the house whose number is
written on the plaque of house (that is, to house ), then he goes to the
house whose number is written on the plaque of house (that is, to house
), and so on.We know that: When the penguin starts walking from any
house indexed from 1 to , inclusive, he can walk to house number 1. When
the penguin starts walking from any house indexed from to , inclusive,
he definitely cannot walk to house number 1. When the penguin starts
walking from house number 1, he can get back to house number 1 after
some non-zero number of walks from a house to a house. You need to find
the number of ways you may write the numbers on the houses’ plaques so
as to fulfill the three above described conditions. Print the remainder
after dividing this number by .
